com.adobe.pdfservices.operation.pdfops

Class SplitPDFOperation

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.adobe.pdfservices.operation.pdfops.SplitPDFOperation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Operation

    public class SplitPDFOperation
extends Object
implements Operation
    An operation that splits PDF document into multiple smaller documents by simply specifying either the number of files, pages per file, or page ranges.

    Sample Usage: 

       SplitPDFOperation splitPDFOperation = SplitPDFOperation.createNew();
   splitPDFOperation.setInput(FileRef.createFromLocalFile("~/Documents/splitPDFOperationInput.pdf",
                                                             SplitPDFOperation.SupportedSourceFormat.PDF.getMediaType()));
   splitPDFOperation.setPageCount(2);
   Credentials credentials = Credentials.serviceAccountCredentialsBuilder().fromFile("pdfservices-api-credentials.json").build();
   List<FileRef> result = splitPDFOperation.execute(ExecutionContext.create(credentials));
   int index = 0;
   for (FileRef fileRef : result) {
      fileRef.saveAs("output/splitPDFOperationOutput_" + index + ".pdf");
      index++;
   }

        public static SplitPDFOperation createNew()

      • setInput

        public void setInput(FileRef sourceFileRef)
        Sets an input file.
        Parameters:
        sourceFileRef - an input file; can not be null

      • setPageRanges

        public void setPageRanges(PageRanges pageRanges)
        Sets the page ranges on the basis of which to split the input PDF file. Each page range corresponds to a single output file having the pages specified in the page range.
        Parameters:
        pageRanges - page ranges for split; can not be null or empty

      • setPageCount

        public void setPageCount(int pageCount)
        Sets the maximum number of pages each of the output files can have.
        Parameters:
        pageCount - maximum number of pages per output file

      • setFileCount

        public void setFileCount(int fileCount)
        Sets the number of documents to split the input PDF.
        Parameters:
        fileCount - represents the number of output files

      • execute

        public List<FileRef> execute(ExecutionContext context)
                      throws ServiceApiException,
                             IOException,
                             ServiceUsageException
        Executes this operation synchronously using the supplied context and returns a new list of FileRef instances for the resultant PDF files.

        The resultant files may be stored in the system temporary directory (per java.io.tmpdir System property). See FileRef for how temporary resources are cleaned up.

        Specified by:
        execute in interface Operation
        Parameters:
        context - the context in which to execute the operation
        Returns:
        list of resultant PDF files
        Throws:
        ServiceApiException - if an API call results in an error response
        IOException - if there is an error in reading either the input source or the resulting PDF file
        ServiceUsageException - if service usage limits have been reached or credentials quota has been exhausted
